provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. All that parcel of land part of Millennium Hall in the parish
of Saint James containing by survey Thirty-nine Perches and Nine-
Tenths of a Perch of the shape and dimensions and butting as appears
by the Plan thereof thereunto annexed and being the whole of the
land comprised in Certificate of Title registered at Volume 1177 Folio
984 of the Register Book of Titles.

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:

                     ''The Church" means the persons for the time being
                          associated in Jamaica under the name of The
                         Good News Church of God of Jamaica;
                     ''The Corporation" means the body incorporated by
                          this Act.

                    (2) No act or proceedings of the Corporation shall
              be invalidated by reason of any vacancy in the body or
              in any of the offices mentioned in the preceding subsection
              or by any defect in the appointment of any person to any
              such office.
                    (3) The seal of the Corporation shall be of such
              design and pattern as the Corporation may from time to
              time determine.
                     (4) Upon the recording in the Island Record Office or
               the lodging at the Office of Titles of a certificate under
               the seal of the Corporation of the appointment of any
              person to any of the offices mentioned in subsection (1)
              of this section the person named in such certificate shall
              be deemed to be the holder of the office named therein until
              the recording or lodging of a certificate of the appoint-
              ment of another person to such office.
                    (5) No deed or document purporting to be executed
              by the Corporation shall be of any force or validity unless
              it be sealed with the seal of the Corporation and signed
              by not less than two members of the Corporation, one of
              whom shall be the overseer for the time being of the Church.
Vesting of
property.       4.-(1) All lands and hereditaments and all goods, chat-
              tels and personal property in Jamaica which are now legally
              or equitably the property of the Church or are now held in
              trust for the purpose of the Church or are now held or
             possessed on behalf of the Church by the officials, ministers
             or members of the Church or any of them are hereby trans-
             ferred to and vested in the Corporation, its successors
             and assigns subject to all trusts, mortgages, charges, rights,
             resrvations or incumbrances (if any) affecting the same or
             any part thereof.
                    (2) All property real and personal in the Island of
             Jamaica devised or bequeathed by will or otherwise given
             to the Church or to any person for the benefit of the Church
             The Good News Church of God of Jamaica    [No. 24]               5
               (Incorporation and Vesting) Act, 2002
shall be held by, and is hereby vested in, and shall be
deemed to be, the property of the Corporation.

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3. All that parcel of unregistered land situate at Tangle River in
 the parish of Saint James containing by estimation Forty Feet by
 Twenty-Seven Feet butting and bounding East by the main road
 between Flamstead Gardens and Point, North on land belonging to
 Andrew Erskine, South by a 6 foot road from the comer of Mabel
 Lawrence property, West by lands belonging to Shirley Bowlin or
howsoever otherwise the same may be butted, known, distinguished
or described being the whole of the land comprised in Deed of
Indenture dated the 24th day of February, 1981, between Shirley
Bowlin and the United Church of God Association.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5. The Corporation shall have the power to:-                    Power of
                                                                  the Corpo
    (a)   acquire, hold, purchase, lease, possess and enjoy ration.
          any lands and hereditaments whatsoever in fee
          simple or leasehold or for any other estate or
          interest therein, and all property real, personal or
          mixed;
    (b) give, grant, let, charge, improve, manage, develop,
        exchange, lease, mortgage, sell, convey, assign,
        dispose of, turn to account, or otherwise deal with
        all or any of the property both present and future,
        so held or any part thereof;
    (c) borrow, raise or secure the payment of money in
        such manner as may be thought fit and in parti-
        cular and by the issue of debenture or script
        charged upon all or any of the property (both
        present and future) held by or vested in the Cor-
        poration, and to redeem and pay off such securities;
    (d) appoint a person as the Attorney of the Corpora-
        tion either generally or for a limited period and
        for such purposes and with powers as may be stated
        in the power of attorney, and to revoke any such
        appointment;
    (e) build, operate and maintain places of worship
        and such other buildings and facilities as may be
        necessary or convenient for the purposes of the
        Church; and
    (f)   make such rules and by-laws as it may think fit in
          order to carry out the purposes of this Act.
